page.title: 06TRAFFIC SURVEY
page.content: A recent traffic survey was designed to compare the number of vehicles using the A2 (New Dover Road) and the A257(Canterbury-Littlebourne Rd). The vehicles were also classified according to country of origin using evidence of No. plates. Before the survey was undertaken, it was assumed that the volume of traffic using the A2 would be much greater than the A257 which connects Canterbury with Sandwich. One unknown variable,however, was the influence of the by-pass route which inevitably diverts some long-distance traffic. 15 minute counts at critical periods of the day were carried out. The times chosen were 8.30am, 12.00 n00n, 5.00pm and 9.00pm. The figures fluctuated considerably through the day but clear patterns emerged.
